elements.2211.03046_84c1de9ca9ce07ec2d7f669558eef: Legal judgment Prediction (LJP), aiming to predict a judgment based on fact descriptions, serves as legal assistance to mitigate the great work burden of limited legal practitioners
elements.2211.03046_9166a347dc385bedca49a72e2ddd9: Most existing methods apply various large-scale pre-trained language models (PLMs) finetuned in LJP tasks to obtain consistent improvements
elements.2211.03046_e13704d7a08fd235bdddcd960b796: However, we discover the fact that the state-of-the-art (SOTA) model makes judgment predictions according to wrong (or non-casual) information, which not only weakens the model's generalization capability but also results in severe social problems like discrimination
elements.2211.03046_6659480a134ffbf2bac0d68673315: Here, we analyze the causal mechanism misleading the LJP model to learn the spurious correlations, and then propose a framework to guide the model to learn the underlying causality knowledge in the legal texts
elements.2211.03046_a80802103a84c6778df87066abe9f: Specifically, we first perform open information extraction (OIE) to refine the text having a high proportion of causal information, according to which we generate a new set of data
elements.2211.03046_3ddb0a3123d38bfff7b613de546f5: Then, we design a model learning the weights of the refined data and the raw data for LJP model training
elements.2211.03046_276396350da8e3402d017d24e5afb: The extensive experimental results show that our model is more generalizable and robust than the baselines and achieves a new SOTA performance on two commonly used legal-specific datasets.
elements.2211.03046_ea28cc17bd0c07e82e677574d3980: Understanding why is critical for Legal judgment prediction (LJP) models, which determines whether the legal artificial intelligence (legal AI) yields to the rule of law or to the rule of correlation
elements.2211.03046_42d7f4b7afd1d00bfd7eec9394f66: LJP is a crucial task of legal AI
elements.2211.03046_c4448b4d74cda59bfd4b64c646fb8: A LJP model aims at assisting the legal practice by predicting the judgment of a certain case (e.g., charge, term of penalty, or law article) according to the corresponding case fact descriptions
elements.2211.03046_9548e99621de86f27a5d25390d636: In contrast to other natural-language processing tasks, the LJP model must correctly learn the reasons behind each case rather than only make predictions
elements.2211.03046_ac03cf3f99b8b1dc033223efdb663: Rule of law defines the uniform principles and protocols for all judgments in a country
elements.2211.03046_8735d7e67c1cd1bb4aa6e8e9fd61f: Every judgment must have a clear reasoning process that can cite back to the rules in the laws
elements.2211.03046_228ad31588929bbae8613e2ff52d3: Therefore, there exists a stable and uniform common ground-truth knowledge underlying all judgment cases
elements.2211.03046_4f4fd763c8120e2226647e7bd672a: If a LJP model is legitimated to be adopted for legal practice, it has to learn the common ground-truth knowledge
elements.2211.03046_e18fd12140ae1154f8dd772368120: Otherwise, the judgment prediction is invalid even if it is accurate when fitting the historical cases
elements.2211.03046_0e3f43bc8cb3a181430964cc41b3e: To sum up, only by learning rules of law represented by common ground causality, can models perform better, achieve more robustness, and be trustworthy.
elements.2211.03046_7a966a2f1d3676fde45efafe52e0f: However, we found clues that the commonly adopted state-of-art LJP model misunderstands the data and learn the spurious correlations
elements.2211.03046_5d4a3290418e183f2904288b9ce59: The current LJP model can make right predictions according to wrong reasons, which has not been reported yet
elements.2211.03046_ff1f34805a6267e85f5d6f31f7e4a: , we provide an example, where the prediction of Legal-BERT is reversed by a small change that does not cause an essential semantic change
elements.2211.03046_d192da62353ac02294814bc0a21d9: Further, we discovered that the most important keywords deciding the model predictions mainly concentrated on punctuation marks
elements.2211.03046_e5db6f5a3b4f73457101ac0a6c5c4: A large number of predictions only rely on less than three words rather than considering the whole text as shown in Figure
elements.2211.03046_9fadc995396a0508fbe8062a48e67: All the evidence indicates that the current LJP models learned shortcuts rather than the common ground-truth knowledge about the rules of the laws
elements.2211.03046_74c98ba20a7062d7b75347ac8e8a4: Predicting without understanding not only hurts the trusts on the LJP models, but also weakens those models' generalization capabilities and robustness
elements.2211.03046_c8196041da9ae3b44e0c11fef90e5: If the model does not learn the ground-truth knowledge underlying the cases but overfits for spurious correlations, the model is hard to work well in another dataset that has different writing patterns
elements.2211.03046_c34a6f931236519e1e7eacbe7aedc: Relying on spurious information also made the model more vulnerable under adversarial attacks
elements.2211.03046_5ed32fd6339927c6648b1b732dca4: If the irrelevant features are modified (attacked), models will largely change their predictions, which brings severe social problems.
elements.2211.03046_f0a09386122174c0e7f6a6af345c0: In this paper, we theoretically analyze the mechanism how the nature of the data of legal-case texts leads the LJP model to learn spurious correlations
elements.2211.03046_e2670bd0395c214218bcd7ca1d8ff: We further demonstrate that learning the spurious correlations makes the LJP models less generalizable and more venerable
elements.2211.03046_a777974dff10ad981c151bf4f6bae: We propose a method to mitigate misleading information in the process of training our proposed model
elements.2211.03046_11196826f1713cb2a7d4b8d78d31d: The extensive experimental results demonstrate that our model performs better for generalization and robustness than the baseline models and achieves a new SOTA performance on the two commonly used legal prediction datasets.
elements.2211.03046_dfd4243df1b20bf5ff4e9111cd7b6: Legal text processing, including legal judgment prediction (LJP), charge prediction, and legal file classification, is a long-standing task that has been studied for decades
elements.2211.03046_14f2cabbc654ce554aff6acfe97a4: Previous methods on legal text processing are based on rules
elements.2211.03046_e12a1effd4d153d524a4e1a8ac9a8: , which suffers from being sensitive to noises and lacking generalization ability w.r.t. other law domains
elements.2211.03046_57c664deea8c7b4c062e8d502794d: Recently, the rapid development of large-scale pre-trained language models (PLMs) based on transformers significantly benefits this area
elements.2211.03046_237fbaddb887580ffd8b8e9c82881: Some of the PLMs including BERT
elements.2211.03046_db67616e4ec29c8ea69ba9a8ade33: are further pre-trained on legal corpora, such as Legal-BERT
elements.2211.03046_d2d43b8e9d2bfd8ab1ec6498fb176: , exhibiting the SOTA performance on legal text processing benchmarks (e.g., LexGLUE)
elements.2211.03046_a76c347dfc446a66f093ad27b791c: However, in the meantime, some severe problems of models are also discovered, including unfairness and discrimination
elements.2211.03046_1c81e9fbdcc5eacd09197cb1cf72f: We take a step further towards diagnosing the problems by feature attribution, and then theoretically analyze the underlying causes
elements.2211.03046_530a8a5c1faff288cf83810accdb8: After that, we give our solution and finally demonstrate its effectiveness by extensive experimental results.
elements.2211.03046_faf44eb2c956ba646f9f802593dba: Structural information includes syntax trees, knowledge bases (KBs), and graphs consisting of entities, arguments, and relations between them
elements.2211.03046_2e852ecf4edf9fcf5241f4965b49c: We build the graphs for the purpose of removing less useful and reserving more important information in fact descriptions
elements.2211.03046_acd9b304e1f3b465674ede5fa06fe: Previous work infuse PLM with structural information by either applying graph neural networks (GNNs) after PLM encoders
elements.2211.03046_ba78254c475d8b983fd423ac572d1: , converting graphs to adjacent matrices to mask some computations in attention mechanism of PLM
elements.2211.03046_f6ac66a5cd9bb57b7b5599d1f4848: , or finetuning PLM on the sentences supervised by KBs
elements.2211.03046_ff18382993af2c131cabe86441ab0: argue that the transformer itself is able to process the structural information
elements.2211.03046_4383d7d82a93016532b0e49c2887b: To utilize the ability of the transformer and avoid the discrepancy caused by merging heterogeneous information (text and graphs), we perform graph linearization to convert graphs to texts, and then employ a transformer to encode it.

elements.2211.03046_8e92df04de358b9ed861b2f5c7ff0: Thus, we adopt the OIE and open-source coreference methods to refine the dataset of legal texts
elements.2211.03046_5152d935cbdb12362ed9328dfd785: We first perform open information extraction (OIE) on input legal texts to discard the context that contains a high proportion of non-causal information

elements.2211.03046_fc0dd152626eee167620441ed7c3c: During the process of constructing graphs, redundant non-causal information is further reduced by merging
elements.2211.03046_ce774a8bdd5e522127b1246bef515: Meanwhile, documents are substantially compressed to focus on core information
elements.2211.03046_d4ec4459d236ee319cf88a1b8ea85: Finally, to avoid the conflict and inconsistency that occurred in encoding heterogeneous information through Transformer
elements.2211.03046_2bdf9cb076137cb2f085a1fb01e99: , we perform graph linearization to model the extracted graphs as sequences
elements.2211.03046_2932d1236261994fd5e66f97aca73: The above data processing lowers the proportion of
elements.2211.03046_e13237a1188034d008d083e23a322: in the legal-case texts, thereby mitigating the spurious correlation between
elements.2211.03046_d181b520eef5fb8d0cc4c98f4fc86: We further develop a training method to incorporate the processed data and the raw data for balancing the spurious correlation mitigation and information loss minimization
elements.2211.03046_62a1bcff6d54ac3fd0b8704904f57: In the rest of this section, we provide the detail of our methods.
elements.2211.03046_133bb9fad09719a4f58d5ae6ce8af: In this section, we detail the process of extracting graph structures from text, which aims to discard and merge redundant non-causal information
elements.2211.03046_d447180942635a1cb554952126b35: tools to identify the corresponding mentions or pronouns of each entity, and then extract relational triplets from sentences
elements.2211.03046_05c70c1850c89ac27abab8f6883fd: In our constructed graph, we represent subjects and objects as nodes, which are connected by predicates as directed edges
elements.2211.03046_b06d07a8bd53ab47ca187f2eaa66e: Second, the nodes will be merged to reduce redundant non-causal information if they have similar names or meanings, which is identified by TF-IDF overlap and coreference resolution tools, respectively
elements.2211.03046_0feafa2f7f6ac5f305921835b7874: Finally, as to the subsequent newly extracted triplets, we also calculate the TF-IDF overlap between the existing triplets and the new one
elements.2211.03046_77d40295f147471c3b7d10f891970: If the value is higher than our predefined threshold, we rule out the new triplet to reduce information replication.
elements.2211.03046_656a02cba083108acbe4b364bc474: Existing methods of converting graphs into sequences can roughly be divided into two categories: training graph-to-sequence models
elements.2211.03046_b6a218b25dfc5f72aa0fec9597fe4: , and artificially designing some rules to store graphs in structured sequence which is called graph linearization
elements.2211.03046_2eace328105d5f63d4a54da9dbaa5: The latter faithfully express a graph and the former introduce noises in their generated sequences
elements.2211.03046_8d9477cef5ba4f0815cde3b3b310b: To avoid introducing new non-causal information which may induce new spurious correlations, we adopt a graph linearization method, which is considered more suitable
elements.2211.03046_c2ac9c10408c67460ceea4655f61d: Specifically, we first obtain the weights of nodes and edges by counting how many times their corresponding phrases appear in a document
elements.2211.03046_6df0c0a8834abd33d36af9d5efcd9: Second, we perform graph traversal in a breadth-first manner according to the weights
elements.2211.03046_3c34cf0999714a74a95410b03ac9f: Finally, the resulting sequences of graph traversal are adopted as the linearized graphs.
elements.2211.03046_3410dbfdcbd1e8e3b183d7f453743: Due to the inevitable errors of OIE tools, a small amount of causal information can be discarded during the process of constructing graphs
elements.2211.03046_cf66d189547a13046c35b3429bcaa: Therefore, it remains necessary to refer to the original text beyond linearized graphs when predicting judgments
elements.2211.03046_b1e7a01e71ae09de02ad74941453f: While the extent to which our model learns from the originals should be restricted, we propose our model to adaptively learn the weights of the linearized graphs and the original raw data
elements.2211.03046_37876d371b5a87ce7bd934cc68a17: To minimize the possibility of learning the spurious information from the raw data, we penalize the model when learning from the raw data and encourage it to learn from the linearized graphs

elements.2211.03046_b2ef26cdc133cc3cc16bc7522b16f: In this paper, we reveal the principles for tackling the fatal problem
elements.2211.03046_37b864b603a4cd18cf3d86a9fb074: We use structural causal models (SCMs) to theoretically analyze the mechanism of learning models in the LJP task and then argue that three factors hamper the development of the current LJP models
elements.2211.03046_71d3ff99580f10c6b1c189a8f7f49: Specifically, our analysis derives that the main challenge of learning models in this task is to infer the unique causal mechanism from its generated training data
elements.2211.03046_8221d74200a1b34e32e72af19900d: Significant development rarely occurs in tackling this challenge due to three reasons
elements.2211.03046_10ab4c80932d1b1d3164f9b32da71: First, the learning models themselves neglect the use of human knowledge, which largely increases the uncertainty for them to infer causal relationships from the training data
elements.2211.03046_550c86fa0f6184c1eb7e867d7090f: Second, each case in the training data suffers from the problem of data imbalance, where high-frequency words often co-occur with other words and thus lead to the spurious correlation issue
elements.2211.03046_96ead07495e3d633b68ea3de77429: Third, our current evaluation methods focus on measuring average error across a held-out test set, neglecting the fact that the test set and training set are identically independently distributed (i.i.d.): Models just need to greedily absorb all correlations that happen to be predictive in the test set even if they are not causal relationships
elements.2211.03046_17f83345b0fbb1d79f3a97070e0f2: To address the issues, we provide two methods focusing on the improvement of training data and the architecture of models, respectively
elements.2211.03046_834208354d78bdefc8d186dce93ec: From the perspective of data, we focus on mitigating the disturbance from non-causal information by removing them from the training data and thus propose a causal information-enhanced sampling method (CIESAM)
elements.2211.03046_03b7fe2a4c58c939a47f94ada0d87: From the perspective of model architecture, we aim to prevent the PLM from learning non-causal information by restricting the interaction (represented by attention weights) between causal and non-causal words
elements.2211.03046_0092ad2f69c44537439f9e7018f3c: Specifically, we propose a causality-aware self-attention mechanism (CASAM) to reallocate the attention weights throughout the overall transformer encoder, which leads the PLM to pay more attention to causal information
elements.2211.03046_8d065dfebe597eb163df843d62a16: The extensive experimental results show that both of our proposed methods perform better on generalization and robustness than the baseline models and achieve new SOTA performance on the three commonly used legal prediction datasets
elements.2211.03046_ec4246883a3fdba87eda239ee812d: Additionally, CASAM performs better than CIESAM as it learns from the unique ground-truth causal relationship.
